greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of digits of 1/n in factorial base.
comment: See the Wikipedia link for the construction method of 1/n in factorial base.
For n>1, A002034(n) gives the number of significant digits of 1/n in factorial base.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Rémy Sigrist, Colored logarithmic scatterplot of the first 25000 terms (where the color is function of A052126(n))
Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{s = 0, r = 1, a = 1/n}, While[a > 0, s += Floor[a]; r++; a = FractionalPart[a]*r]; s] (* after Rémy Sigrist *); Array[f, 70] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 01 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(s=0, r=1, f=1/n); while (f>0, s+= floor(f); r++; f = frac(f)*r); s}
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Dec 12 2016
